website_summaries.verdict: Best for larger lunch boxes or coolers, these are long-lasting ice packs that work well to keep food cold.
pros: These ice packs work so well many customers had repeat or multiple orders
They get top marks for keeping food and beverages cold (some said up to 2 days) as well as being easy to use and having good instructions
We love that it provides great cooling without the bulk
cons: A few experience rips in the packs after multiples uses

customer_reviews.title: Defective Design Rips
customer_reviews.text: The mylar bag rips where the plastic cap attaches to the mylar bag. They only offer 6 month replacement for this 'known' defect. I now have 2 bags that will eventually tear and leak. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: v. nhan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I brewed some beer in November, bottled it in April and its been aging in a cooler in our Texas garage. The temp in the garage has been between 80 and 95 degrees, but the cooler has been sitting between 45 and 55. These packs are doing the job. They arrive without water so you have to add that to activate the gel. Follow the directions and you'll be set to go. (I bought these to replace some plastic freezer packs that I had bought at a local sporting goods store. They did fine, but after days of daily use they started to leak.)
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Best cold packs ever
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from a 4 day camping trip where I put 6 of my large Cooler Shock packs to the test. I want to start by saying not only was I pleased with the packaging, instructions, and contents of my order, I was impressed with the performance of these Cooler Shock packs. I used these in addition to a bag of ice and a few blocks of ice and my cooler kept all its contents refrigerator cold and colder for all 4 days. I'm very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: Damaged & poor description
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these for a camping trip but couldn't use them because they needed to be prepped & there wasn't enough time between receipt & leaving for our trip. This is my second attempt to contact you. As I said in my original message, one of these was leaking & the description really was not clear about needing 48 hours to prepare for use. I have a received a partial refund, but I believe I am entitled to a full refund. I will remove the 1 star rating if this is settled. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last more than a month and a half. Bag began to break down at corners. Leaking chemicals. I used it in a cooler to keep my water cold during work.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay cold long
customer_reviews.text: I have a great cooler that keeps block ice for 3+ days. I was really excited to have another option for ice, and these DO NOT WORK. I don't know why there are so many high ratings. Placed packs in coolers early evening, and they stayed frozen through the night, and the next day they were completely thawed out by afternoon. They kept cool but not cold enough to make it worth it! I DO NOT RECOMMEND, nor do I ever write reviews. Returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jody G.

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these packs hoping to keep a cooler full of food cold for possibly 24 hours. They were easy to fill, flat enough to take up little room in the cooler. I put 3 packs into my medium-large cooler and the food was still very cold after 12 hours. I have only used them one time. They worked better than other freezer packs that I’ve tried. -
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: 2 year Review: Tear Next to Cap
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 packs in May 2018. After 2 years of occasional usage (approx. 10-12x/year of camping or shopping trips) one of the packs developed a 2 inch tear next to the cap, leaking the contents out. The packs were used in a Yeti cooler, always frozen, used and stored flat with the cap side up. Overall, the performance was OK, staying frozen/cool for at least 8-10 hours. Not great for long term use, I'd recommend something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: G-Rapid

customer_reviews.title: Not strong material
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok the first two times we used it. However after the third time when we pulled it out of our cooler all of the inner material spilled out of a seam on the side. We had nothing but some cans of soda and meat in it, so nothing even remotely sharp that could have cut through the material. Pretty disappointed because I loved how it made it so there wasn't a bunch of water in the bottom of the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product that is very easy to fill (screw cap ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product that is very easy to fill (screw cap model) and seal. Used alone you can pre chill a large cooler or use them in a smaller cooler to alleviate the need for cubed/block ice. Use in conjuntion with ice to really stretch the limits of your cooler. Will definatley be buying more of these! Also pick up the mesh sacks they protect your packs and protect your hands from directly touching the frozen packs.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Was camping for a couple days with a friend who had these and swore by them. My cooler was filled with sloppy melted ice while theirs was nice and dry AND cold. Bought a package of these awhile ago and just now did the "assembly" as I am getting ready to head out camping again, sans sloppy melted ice. When I first read the instructions and saw that it required "ironing" the bag closed the first thought was that ironing bag was going to mess up the iron or I would ruin the pouch. Well, the whole assembly and sealing process was a piece of cake and nothing to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Musser

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 3 day camping trip.
customer_reviews.text: We used these for a weekend camping trip. So it need to keep a cooler cold for 3 days. I was concerned about food safety so I froze maybe 1/3 of the food we put in the cooler. At the end of the 3 days these packs were mostly still frozen with just a little bit of melting around the edges and all the food was still cold. I wasn't worried about the temperature of the food at all while we were camping. I don't think just three of these is enough for a big cooler we also had a plastic jug with ice it. A great product I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz and Ian

customer_reviews.title: ... started getting not cold the 3rd day which was fine cause we were headed home anyways
customer_reviews.text: Camped for 3 days using a 100qt cooler and it started getting not cold the 3rd day which was fine cause we were headed home anyways. I'm sure it would have lasted longer but my husband and 2 kids opened it profusely and we were in Nevada and it was over 100°. Now I've turned my fridge down to the lowest setting to conserve electricity and I rotate the ice bags and it keeps everything as cold as I used to keep my fridge. I'm probably going to buy more because my husband works construction outside in Las Vegas and it's been 115 lately and it keeps his lunch nice and cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These melt faster than ice
customer_reviews.text: I put 3 large packs & 5 small packs in my cooler for a 2 day trip. The packs were barely cool within 24 hours. I had only got into the cooler about 4 times, quickly opening, getting what I needed and closing the cooler. We had a 2nd cooler with ice in it. After 2 days, there was still ice in the cooler. I do not refer these packs to anyone. You'll be better freezing water bottles for the bottom of your cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah A Renner

customer_reviews.title: These do not deflate
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased these I thought I'd be able to deflate them (fill with water, freeze, use, pour out the water). The water activates a gel solution which is meant to permanently hold shape. So if you get the really big ones, after you inflate them, you're stuck with these really big freezer packs with no where to put them. I thought if they deflated I could fold them up and put them away... So five stars for working really well in terms of keeping everything cold... But 3 stars for storage...
customer_reviews.author: Altair Rasco

customer_reviews.title: Super Cold For A Super Long Time!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I have this set, and a set of the lunch bag size packs. They really chill your coolers & lunch bags,last a very long time, and are so much better than ice because they don't melt! I put 1 XL pack & a bunch of beverages in my cooler when hitting the beach. These packs stay crazy cold all day, even with the cooler in direct sunlight, just don't let anyone dick around in there or forget to close it and it'll keep your cooler COLD for 24+ hours! I also bought the nets as suggested so my beverages don't actually freeze if they're touching the pack. Great product, excellent purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: NoneOfYerBizniz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a good idea and I had high hopes these would be useful for a long camping trip in a hot place. In less than two days, they had lost all their cooling power and were simply taking up room This was in a well insulated cooler that advertises keeping food cold for several days if used properly Cooler worked great with ice and frozen water bottles but these ice packs really didn’t help The bummer is that I bought a lot of them and they weren’t cheap
customer_reviews.author: Debbi Ashby

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: These are AMAZING! I use these with a small drink cooler that I keep in my work car. I use 1 or 2 packs depending on how cold I want my drinks. 1 pack will keep my drinks refrigerator-cold for about 10-12 hours and 2 packs will often start to freeze whatever is inside with them and keeps them cold for up to 2 days (obviously not as cold on the second day but cold enough to enjoy). Preparation was really easy and instructions were pretty straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: Average Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but particles in bag are loose and can spill out during initial fill
customer_reviews.text: I like how long the product stayed frozen, but the directions don’t make it clear that you have to be careful when filling the bags for the first (and only) time. Maybe I’m just slow, but I accidentally put in too much water, went to dump it, and realized that I dumped down the drain a fair amount of the gel capsules that hydrate when you add water. So I lost a lot of the gel filling the first time around. A simple warning at the top of the directions informing you that the particles are loose in each of the three bags would have been helpful for me. But the product works great.
customer_reviews.author: CountFathom

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: These work better than any cooler ice I have ever tried and I have tried quite a few. Even will freeze water that collects in the bottom of cooler. I did a test in a 50 liter Yeti type cooler. Added four bottles of frozen ice and one cooler shock. No food or drink. Temp actually dropped for the first 12 hours to below freezing. I got about 2 days worth of under 40 degree temps. I quite the experiment at this point. I would highly recommend. I have not had any of the durability issues others describe but I have only used the packs on a 5 day fishing trip in Canada. Used mainly to keep the drinks cold.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: A must have for long-term cooler'ing!
customer_reviews.text: If you need to keep stuff super cold in a 48qt cooler for 24hrs this will do it! I went tubing in the hot sun and the pack on the bottom was still frozen-solid 12hrs later. The 2 that I put on the sides/top were only half-slushy. My leftover stuff was still super-cold. If you ever need to maximize space in a cooler and have it last a long-long time with little cleanup - this is your product! I just easily lifted the 3 packs out and put them right back in the freezer for the next time. So much better than ice!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hitchcock

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product. Beats dry ice by a landslide.
customer_reviews.text: Using these a lot lately due to moving and having to drive over 600 miles one way back and forth between two places. They have kept all my items extremely cold, even in hot temperatures, cooler left in car, and while driving. I’ve used these and the hard back ones in different coolers to keep milk, creamer, frozen foods, perishable foods, etc cold. Products exceeded my expectations and are very durable. Easy to set up and use. Glad I have them.
customer_reviews.author: Andria Ragland

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much! They're super easy to set-up that first initial time. I was a little overwhelmed by the set-up process, but don't be! It's super easy! These stay frozen for a long time. I was able to use them for a 10-hour road trip and have the packs still be slightly frozen. It does add a lot of weight to the item you're adding them to, but they're worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Allyson Brackett

customer_reviews.title: Kept Yeti 45 Cooler Cold for 10-Day Camping Trip
customer_reviews.text: These cooler packs started out freezing everything at first. As time went on, the inside temp of the cooler reached "refrigerator temperatures," and still kept food fresh. If we had stayed longer, we probably would have had to add cubed ice to the cooler. I bought the mesh bags for the Cooler Shock packs. I also left them in the freezer to "charge" before our trip for 5 days. My suggestion: don't take green salad spring mix and put under the cooler packs. It WILL freeze. Carrots, celery, radishes, broccoli slaw, and even cucumbers did OK, though.
customer_reviews.author: April M. Love

customer_reviews.title: Freeze water instead
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Convenient size for freezer Cons: Difficult to initially fill and seal Don't last long Subject to leakage. If the iron heated seal that YOU applied, fails the zip lock is worthless. I lost one first use. A throwaway as the magic ingredient went all over the place. This is the 3rd brand I've used. They are all more about marketing than function. I'm going back to frozen water in an OJ container. Cheap, easy, far better leak resistance. If you insist, I suggest you purchase pre-filled and sealed packs.
customer_reviews.author: RaytoTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Used these in Yosemite.  Amazing product!!
customer_reviews.text: We took a three day trip driving from Los Angeles. We packed the cooler on a Wednesday morning and left at around 4am to drive the six hours to Yosemite. We used three of the Large 10x14 cooler packs. I had put in some raw steaks, raw ground turkey, raw chicken along with cheeses, butter, milk, eggs and some other perishables. Ice was put on top and in between. The ice never melted!! Everything was so icy cold. Even the butter. This is such a quality product. So glad we purchased and well worth the money. Cant wait to reuse them on our next trip!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have ordered these.The first set had the zip closure. I use these things in my cooler that stays in my Tahoe all year. I am on a primitive farm 10 hours a day. I am in Charleston SC where the temp is in the upper 90's four months of the year.I used to buy a 10lb. of ice every other day. simple math =$450 a year. I love these things I have 7 and rotate them 2 at a time My drinks and food stay very close to 32 dregrees. some thing will freeze. GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: joe sproles

customer_reviews.title: STAYS COLD FOR A REALLY LONG TIME!
customer_reviews.text: Got these also for my husband's lunch box (he's gone for 12 hours a day so has a large one) and these things are still cold when he gets home with it in the early evening AND this is when I've made lunch the night before stuck these in the lunchbox and stuck the lunchbox in the fridge until he takes them at O Dark Thirty in the mornings.
customer_reviews.author: Cie

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Quick, Large, Clean and Holds Freeze
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fill and freezes pretty quickly for how large it is. Highly suggest making room to freeze it laying down flat, in order to minimize width and maximize cooler space when being used. Just took it camping and had it in cooler (shown in picture), stored outside on bench for 24 hours (temp. got as high as 82), and it was still partially frozen. If I were using a higher end cooler and kept in car/shade I would fully expect it to be frozen for 2 days min. All in all, way better than ziplocks and ice cubes! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMENDATION: BUY NOW - Can't really believe it - it works
customer_reviews.text: Recommendation: BUY IT NOW Well.. I don't know how LONG these will last.. but in a soft sided cooler on a 3 and a half hour trip - two of them (one on each soft side) it partially refroze a thawed steak. That's good enough for me and my regular short trips! I would be willing to bet that these hold up at LEAST as well as ICE and based on the specifications listed on the back of them keep things COLDER than ice as well. They are a little pricy, but after using them I think its well worth the investment to not have things all "WET" but be able to keep them nice and cold.
customer_reviews.author: Amos Anon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect freeze mat a must purchase
customer_reviews.text: These freezer packs are freaking awesome!! June of this year family and friends went on a 3 day canoe trip. Stayed frozen all 3 days. I had no issues adding the water and letting the air out. Instead of using an iron, I used my sealer on my automatic vacuum sealing machine. I have literally told everyone about this product! Can't wait to use for my daughter's wedding reception.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Hacker

customer_reviews.title: Defective and unusable
customer_reviews.text: Well that’s a bummer. Followed the instructions perfectly. Everything looked good. And then I realized that gel was oozing out all three ice packs. Seems that something punctured the entire package, putting a screwdriver hole through every single pack. So I’m left wondering what might have been.
customer_reviews.author: barg

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: We just recently purchased these so we haven't had time to get a lot of use out of them but we did use them in an inflatable chilling "pool" for July 4th and it worked great chilling the cold dishes. That said, it was inside the house but they worked beautifully for several hours AND we didn't have to worry about ice melting and leaking everywhere. I went ahead and purchased the NEW hard surface Cooler Shock freezer packs and I have the utmost confidence they will be great as well. The true test will be our vacation - will report back on that in the future.
customer_reviews.author: ThunderRoad

customer_reviews.title: Great  alternative to buying ice
customer_reviews.text: I live in FL and always buying ice for my cooler, purchased these to use with my magellan cooler , I’ve been using this product for about a week and I have to say that I’m very pleased keeps my drinks ice cold and the best part no more dumping the melted ice out I just change the Cooler Shock ice pack first thing in the morning and I’m good to go ,I would definitely purchase this item again and plan to do so in the near future
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: They Work Great
customer_reviews.text: I have these in my freezer always ready and over Thanksgiving holiday I went out of town for four days. Someone turned off my power of my condo at the main breaker I was 300 miles away and could not do anything. When I got home and turned the power back on I checked my Freezer and everything was still frozen and in my refrigerator everything was still cool. I just had to throw a few things out but I attribute this to these Freeze Packs they are awesome. In my cooler they keep everything cool for the day and are still mostly frozen I throw them back into the freezer and they are back to 100% the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Turner

customer_reviews.title: the size and need iron
customer_reviews.text: i did not read or actually see the part where you need an Iron to seal the end of the bag. Also did not realize how large the bag was especially after adding 56ounces of water or 7 cups. i bought a 9 quart cooler and am afraid this is gong to be too large until it is partially thawed after you freeze it, that is. my fault i should have read a bit more closely, Pat Attention. i really thought it would be pliable instead of a semi flat hard as Ice object fortunately i had an iron laying around for removing melted crayons from carpet
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these. These were recommended to us through a camping blog. We use them to keep the food cold in our travel trailer when traveling to camp. I don’t like having the gas on to run the fridge so we throw these in the fridge and it keeps everything way cold when we get to camp I just throw them back in the freezer. They tend to last about 48 house before needing to be refrozen. When yo I first get them you have to add water to them and then mix the mixture in the bag and then you have to squeeze out all the air. It can be a little tricky but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tani McNally

customer_reviews.title: Best ice packs to buy!
customer_reviews.text: These work fantastic! We use these all the time and switch them out so we can keep a set cooling while we are using the opposite set at the time. We are no longer buying ice at all. My husband works outside all day and leaves the cooler in his hot truck. When he gets drinks throughout the day it keeps his water cold to the point almost frozen or at least icy at times when he gets to his truck. His truck was 106 degrees yesterday inside due to the heat. His cooler was still very cold and water icy. We love these ice packs.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi R. Harms

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating and slippery
customer_reviews.text: Unlike ice these don’t surround your items. They have an odd shape so I spent a lot of time packing and repacking my items to work around them. The edges are flat and sharp so I was afraid they would puncture my plastic items. Maybe they will work for someone but they just caused me frustration.
customer_reviews.author: gc

customer_reviews.title: Much better than bags of ice!
customer_reviews.text: When these arrived I was mildly intimidated about having to fill them with water, cork them and cap them, but honestly, it was incredibly simple. They've been in my cooler now for about 30 hours and have barely thawed! I like to go away for 3-4 days at a time and so far these work MUCH BETTER than the bags of ice I had been using. In just a few trips they will end up saving me money, plus they won't end up bathing all my food in melted ice water. I'm very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth L. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Zipper failed
customer_reviews.text: When drying the seam before ironing the pouch sprang a leak, first thought was the zipper opened, wrong, the zipper itself came free from the bag/pouch
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Worked on the Hottest Day!
customer_reviews.text: Each week I purchase meats from the butcher around lunchtime while I'm at work. I was tired of buying ice that only melted and made a mess. I bought these in hopes I could leave the meats in a cooler in my trunk all afternoon while I went back to the office. On the hottest day in July (in New Jersey), I brought the meats home at the end of the day after sitting in a cooler in my trunk, and they were as cold as could be. The packs were still frozen and only melted slightly. I'd highly recommend these for cold storage!!
customer_reviews.author: Ray F.

customer_reviews.title: tarted peeling after first week of use then they started leaking
customer_reviews.text: Mylar started peeling after first week of use then they started leaking. Not sure where all the positive reviews are coming from. I'm very upset with these freezer packs.
customer_reviews.author: NYFisher

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Incredible product. Edges could maybe not be so sharpe (like a knife when frozen) but overall lasted 3 days on a fishing trip in a yeti
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It dont keep food cold for that long. When ...
customer_reviews.text: It dont keep food cold for that long . When i used it for camping Friday we did not go in cooler at all then saturday morning. Food was barely cold
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly dog that likes to sleep on things that are cold. These ice packs are perfect. They are compact and stay cold for a long time. I wrap one in a blanket and it stays cold all day and all night for my pup's comfort. I also thought the shipping was brilliant. Rather than sending bulky packs, these have beads in them that turn into a gel when water is added. Just add your own water and you have a gel freezable pack. I plan to buy more to use in my coolers ;)
customer_reviews.author: I'm a mom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing. We're on a 2 week trip going from hotel to hotel and these things have stayed frozen even when I put them in the little hotel fridge on the coldest setting. They were easy to fill up as well. I would definitely buy these again. I use all 3 in an AO cooler (size 24) to keep my breast milk frozen. They are HUGE and pretty heavy so be prepared for a heavy cooler. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: myranda

customer_reviews.title: They Work Great and Keep Things Really Cold
customer_reviews.text: Have these smaller packs as well as two large ones. I use them in small ice chest or on four sides of a larger bag so I can line the chest with the larger ones on top and bottom. They last over a day even in a lightweight flexible cooler. Even after 24 hours in the fall the aluminum soda cans since form ice inside the can of soda. I am very pleased how cold these small and larger packs keep. I have not tried it for multiple day excursions but only for one and two day trips in the car with a flexible bag. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: technojerry

customer_reviews.title: Best Cold Packs Ever!
customer_reviews.text: We can't stop telling our friends about these, so we figured we should write a review. We put two of these in our large cooler to keep our food cold during a summer camping trip. When we opened our cooler after the first day, we found that the veggies we had packed in water had a layer of ice on the top. Even our hummus was a little frozen! We had originally put everything into the cooler straight from the refrigerator, so these cold packs actually made our food COLDER, which is basically what you want when you're trying to keep food at a safe temperature for a long weekend camping in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Bradim

customer_reviews.title: Good, but prefer the hard pack version
customer_reviews.text: I find them effective but one of mine opened up at the seam near the cap after a month of use. I wasn't happy, but decided to get the hard packs since I don't like grabbing into my cooler to get a drink out with these metal-like bags in it, so I think the hard packs would be a better option. I don't know which cools better, but the hard packs are solid and sit better in my cooler. I will still use these since I bought two packs of them and I feel obligated not to waste money.
customer_reviews.author: C. ToddTop Contributor: Soccer

customer_reviews.title: I have had these bad boys for 4 years of steady useage.
customer_reviews.text: MADE IN USA!! I have had these for 4 years. They have not leaked at all. The foil does show some signs of wear, but they are very durable. I used them quite frequently. I have this size and smaller ones. I pack them in cooler bags with cold bottle of water, the packs will actually freeze the water during 90F+ weather. They are great for keeping grocery store frozen items froze. Another way to use them, put in the middle of drinks in a cooler bag. Then fill the bag with ice. It will supplement the ice and keep it much colder for much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H13

customer_reviews.title: Way better than ice!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t write too many reviews but these things are seriously awesome. Very easy to fill up and freeze and after that they are much more effective than a bag of ice. I put one of the large ones at the bottom of a 32 can cooler and the drinks stay cold all day at the beach. Then you just stick the Cooler Shock back on the freezer and it’s ready to go in the morning. No more trips to the gas station just for ice to fill the cooler or drying off the stuff that’s left in your cooler after the ice melted. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: Don't last!
customer_reviews.text: Specifically says right on them that they last 48 hrs. ,totally not true! Didn't even last 24 hrs! These are terrible, don't buy! Wouldn't even give them one star, but Amazon made me select something.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L.

customer_reviews.title: Best ice packs I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: These work beyond better than any of the other packs I have ever tried and I've used just about all of them in the past. Keeps a Monster at the same temp if not colder than what it was when I bought it out of the fridge case at the gas station. They are large and do not flex once frozen. I use an RTIC 28 can soft cooler as a lunch box and one of these does not fit unless you put it diagonal. This really isnt bad as one is enough to cool the entire thing for more than 8 hours.
customer_reviews.author: AMasterofMayheM

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted these to work as well as the reviews, but they are the worst; doesn't stay frozen and defrosts within 4 hours
customer_reviews.author: ontario JJ

customer_reviews.title: Cooler shock
customer_reviews.text: Just received yesterday. Have not used yet. They look and feel.very thick but yet pliable. Was part of my husband gift. Got 3 sets two for husband and 1 for my dad as a partial Father's Day gift. My husband really like them and then ease of use. The instructions need to be followed. The guidelines and purposes of use is a security to childern. Husband said wow how big "there weren't any smaller? We travel frequently.day trips, over night stays, and lengthier travel and stays. They will definately be used.
customer_reviews.author: Susi

customer_reviews.title: Far exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: These are the answer to keeping things cold in your ice chest. They are very easy to setup and so far they are doing a great job of keeping our groceries cold. It's over an hour to the closest grocery store and the wife has to have ice cream available all the time!!! Not a problem if you have one of these in the ice chest! Not only don't thinhs melt anymore, but instead their colder when we get home than when we left the store!
customer_reviews.author: Chasing and racing

customer_reviews.title: They made it for two 90 degree days in a mid-cheap Coleman cooler on only 16 hours of freeze (which is far less than the recommended 24-48 hours)
customer_reviews.text: Took these out to a summer festival for 4 days in a canyon. They made it for two 90 degree days in a mid-cheap Coleman cooler on only 16 hours of freeze (which is far less than the recommended 24-48 hours). Not hard to fill/mix, sturdy looking... I'm curious to see how they hold up for the rest of the summer, but they worked within spec given that I was using them wrong first time out... If I camp another 2 times this summer, they've basically paid themselves off the first year.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I love these ice packs! I shop for a living, so I'm out daily and in the hot Texas summer heat these are a life saver with keeping frozen/cold items chilled while I'm delivering my groceries! I got a second 3 pack of these. They hold up for 5-6 hours in our heat in my cooler bags. I actually one time left ice cream in the cooler bag with these ice packs while I did a 40 minute shop at Target - they ice cream didn't melt!
customer_reviews.author: A Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but no better than cheaper alternatives
customer_reviews.text: These packs aren’t bad. They do freeze at a very cold temperature, and they don’t leak or cause any issues. That said, they don’t last any longer or work any better than cheaper alternatives. For the price, you can get more bang for your buck elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: The Ghost of Old J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to keep drinks cold at the ball field all day beside just ice. These work!! Combine these with ice and no need for a Yeti. We put the ice packs on the sides of a cheap Wal-Mart cooler on wheels and put drinks and ice in the middle. We are in and out of the cooler all day and you have to break up the ice to get to the drinks because it kinda freezes the ice together. At the end of a 95+ day at the ball field, there was still ice chunks and the ice packs were still cold and mostly frozen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rated #1 for a reason!
customer_reviews.text: A must have for any cooler, these are rated number one for a reason, they work!! Combine these with frozen milk jugs and keep your cooler working for 2 to 3 days longer than ice alone. If your hunting for a few days or a week, they work exactly as advertised. I use several of these in my RTIC cooler, they help keep my meats and perishable items frozen for longer periods of time!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great  Products-must get another set
customer_reviews.text: I go camping 5 to 7 days at a time. Last 5 day trip was labor day. Now, I freeze my food prior to the trip then added the Shock bags to my cooler. I had to lay out my food to thaw the morning of the 3rd day. By the end of the trip what was left was still very cold but was thawed. I will be purchasing 3 more for future trips. Easy to assemble and like the idea they store flat in my freezer...makes it so easy to line my cooler. I recently purchased the zipper bags to cover them. They don't freeze together or stuck to food anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Louise PHX

customer_reviews.title: Cooler Shock ice packs out performs all other ice pack brands!
customer_reviews.text: I am a commercial truck driver with a 72 quart fully sealed Lifetime cooler with a sealed food storage box insert that I eat out of for six to seven days a week. I was using up to eight 10 lb. bags of ice to safely keep my food and drinks cold during these hot summer days. “Now I use eight large Cooler Shock ice packs.” My food and cooler now stays colder than the best refrigerators. The Cooler Shock ice packs will also be saving me a lot of money that I spend on ice every week, roughly $32.00. Multiple this amount by a year and that’s a lot of cash that turns to water!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: they do a much better job than ice
customer_reviews.text: they do a much better job than ice, I had a problem with one of them splitting at the seam at the cap, the first time it froze.. but Amazon made good and refunded the price of one pack. I use 5 of them in a 180 quart cooler and it keeps things cold all day on my boat. One or two of these in a 48 Quart cooler has partly frozen my gatorade!
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Keep things cool, not cold
customer_reviews.text: These do last for a couple days. But I give them four stars because they do not transfer their temperature and cool the entire cooler down like ice does. I had to place one bag on the bottom of the cooler and then sandwhich my beers between that bag and another to keep them cold, then the food on top of the bag was not that cold. I think these are better suited for keeping things cool, not cold. But they do last a long time and as long as you know what their strengths are, should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: two out of the six I purchased have broken open in my cooler
customer_reviews.text: These are ok. They do last for a couple days in my igloo cooler and keep everything nice and cool. My reasoning for 3 stars is that I bought two sets of large packs of these so I could swap them out. I've used each ice pack once in my cooler and two of these cooler packs have already broken open inside my cooler. So, if you have stainless steel water jugs I would recommend ice packs that are more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Riss

customer_reviews.title: LOVED These.
customer_reviews.text: We are new to camping and seemed to constantly need ice. My friends froze milk cartons and that helped but once I saw these, I thought I would give them a try. These are much better than frozen cartons because they are thin and do not take up much room. They helped us hold ice in the cooler far longer than without using them. I was very happy with them and two groups of our friends have not purchased and love them too.
customer_reviews.author: angelia50

customer_reviews.title: They really work!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews before I purchased, I have to say, I LOVE this product, and I'm so glad that I bought them! I sell chicken eggs at my local farmers markets, and I'm always struggling to keep my eggs cold during the 8+ hours of the farmers market including driving times. In 112f heat yesterday at the the farmers market, this cooler packs worked! I couldn't believe it! You definitely need to follow instructions on pre-freezing them at least 48 hours, since I had used them once before after only 24 hours, and they didn't keep as cold as long. What a great investment, and I'll be buying more of these packs for my other coolers!
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Easily rips
customer_reviews.text: These ice packs are not durable at all. I use ice packs with deliveries and the ice packs only lasted a few uses before they ripped just sitting in a cooler. I have tested many brands and this one is at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Will probably come back and buy more!
customer_reviews.text: We got these before a camping trip to try to avoid buying quite so much ice. Were super impressed -- they keep things nice and cold for a good 2 days. Used them again for picnics -- excellent. And again for a road trip. Worked exactly as they should. Especially if you have access to a freezer every couple days, there would be no need for ice at all. You do need to put a towel or something between them and anything you don't want frozen (fruit, sandwich meat, etc) but that's a great problem to have!
customer_reviews.author: DE Mom

customer_reviews.title: These Really Work!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for a 5 day remote canoe camping trip, where going out to get more ice was a big hassle. It was in the 90s for most of the trip. I didn’t read the directions, overfilled the first pouch with too much water, and had to pour some out. I got to see the space age gel first hand! Long story short, these were still colder than 32 at the end of the trip. There was still bagged ice in the cooler when we packed out. I attribute it to these things. They kept the cooler way colder than ever. Amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: purchased for blackout preparedness here in CA, works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to keep in our freezer in event the power company cuts our power again due to wildfires or from an earthquake, etc. They are very cold and work great. Read the instructions and measure the water you use. Tje instructions were a bit vague saying fill to the top but then use a specific amount of water. I recommend using the specific amount of water so they do not get to large and rip the seams. Freeze lying flat. We are satisfied. Very cold.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. They work as well as described. Been using for months. I use them when I go to Costco or the grocery store with frozen foods on the shopping list. Once I bought a couple of half-gallons of ice cream. I put them in an insulated bag between two freezer packs (with the mesh covers--seek and find). I ran other errands for a couple of hours. By the time I got home the ice cream was more firm than when I took out of the freezer at the grocery store. SOLD! I bought a pack of them for my son for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. Never use ice again
customer_reviews.text: These freezer bags work well. ALMOST too well. I had to buy the mesh bag option (on amazon) to keep my drinks from being in contact with the bags. They get super cold (I brelieve 18 degrees F*) keep cool for a few days, even after they’ve defrosted. I use them in my RTIC cooler and have not had to buy ice (other than for cocktails) at all. Highly recommend these things. Although now I have a whole freezer shelf dedicated to different size cooler shock bags and that’s a problem, but I’m ok with It!
customer_reviews.author: jimmytown

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointing
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to set up (add water, iron closed, etc). They work well in cooler if food is ALREADY FROZEN or VERY COLD, but they do not work well to make something cold (ie: if you have room temp drinks that you want cold for a party or outing). We waited over 5 hours for drinks to get cold and then gave up and put them in the fridge. They are large and must be stored flat in your freezer - otherwise they are very bulky in your cooler. Wouldn't recommend unfortunately. I liked the concept.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stays Cold a long time
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I can't compare it with other similar items of other brands because I've never used themand never will now. I have a large cooler I take to work for my breakfast, lunch and water and this keeps all of them cool for me. I work inside so the cooler isn't exposed to heat all day but I can use 1 pack of the cooler shock for 2 days (it's still very cold the second day) and then I change it out for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Beats Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize these were so large, they are a lot bigger than expected and when I put all three into a bag, add stuff, it's actually pretty heavy. I keep these in a really cheap $5 walmart bag that isn't insulated well at all. We take the bag, drinks and ice packs down to the boat and they stay ice cold all day long in the 100 degrees. If we have a good cooler, I could see these keeping stuff cold all weekend. I would recommend and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Givens

customer_reviews.title: Can refreeze water in your cooler
customer_reviews.text: Borrowed some of these for a trip to Colorado. Used them to keep our drinks cool during the day and cut down on the need to pay for ice. Rotated a new pack in every morning. At one point, the water in the cooler re-froze around the bag. Purchased our own and are looking forward to no longer dealing with all the melt water and weight generated by constantly adding ice.
customer_reviews.author: John Allen

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: The best. My lunchbox sits in the back of a pick up all day. I made the mistake of putting two of them in my box and my stuff was frozen at noon. I do use one of the more expensive coolers but still.
customer_reviews.author: Hambone

customer_reviews.title: shock packs
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better than the thicker, heavier old fashioned ice bricks. Note: Purchase the mesh bags to use with these you will be set for years of use. We've thrown out all our old ice bricks and upgraded to these. Made a 3 day car trip a few months ago. When we arrived, our well packed cooler (using these shock packs) was still very cold and the shock packs themselves were still frozen. Serious. I never hesitate to update my reviews should new info seem useful.
customer_reviews.author: ForeverYOUNGTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Cooler Shock is better than ice!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and easy to follow instructions Utilized for traveling to the BVIs with a cooler full of frozen provisions. All of my items made it safely across 2 days in transit. Cooler shock works great. Looking forward to utilizing cooler shock on our boat this summer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: I tested these before use and for each test they were frozen for 3 days then placed in a prechilled rtic cooker left in a cool room out of sunlight. The cooler was luke warm after 12 hours. Second time the same. They last about 12 hours and by that point they really aren't cold doo with that what you will but these are a big let down. They stay cold for a bit i feel relatively generous at 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Hard pack vs gel pack
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I think these things are great. They held my big coleman cooler about 2.5 days. I think they could go longer but i know also that i need more of these for the cooler size i have. My only complaint is that one of them ripped just under where the screw cap is on the back side. The ooze was oozing out into my cooler upon return of trip. I went ahead and bought this company's hardpacks to test for better durability. Like I said, I need more ice packs anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great packs, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Initially only received 2 sealing plugs for the three ice packs, making one icepack unusable. However, seller contacted promptly and corrected the omission. The freeze packs themselves are great. The 10x14 are quite large, so the cooler itself need to be larger as well, to accommodate the space they take up. They are easy to fill and seal. The one mistake I made was not squeezing the extra air out before sealing then, making the pack larger (thicker) than it needed to be. So don't make the same mistake I did!
customer_reviews.author: S.A.

customer_reviews.title: Lasts and lasts...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for three years with minimal signs of wear and no leakage at all. Although I’ve yet to have them stay freezing cold for 48 hours, they do a good job with keeping food already frozen for 14 to 16 hours or more. I definitely recommend. Colder and longer lasting than anything else I’ve used. Note that you do have to add water, squeeze out the air and then seal with an iron. But it’s super easy. The longest part of the process is getting the iron hot.
customer_reviews.author: BJP

customer_reviews.title: Keeps items colder than ice
customer_reviews.text: Family spends a lot of time on the boat during summer months, we purchased the larger bags for our medium sized cooler to replace the $2.50 week ice we purchased. They are fantastic - haven’t bought ice since. They keep our items cold and as described. Have since purchased the medium size bags for our Coleman soft cooler which is great since we don’t have to worry about melted ice leaking. And recently purchased the smaller bags for our smaller cooler for lunches and golf cart. 5star, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must have- no messy, melting ice!
customer_reviews.text: When used with the right cooler, these last a really long time. We used with a Coleman extreme and things stayed frozen for a week. When used with a soft side cooler the ice packs kept things nice and cold for a day trip. Easy to assemble and use for the first time too.
customer_reviews.author: Partyof7

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 3 day 2 night camping trip. I forgot to charge it for the full 48 hrs but I lowered my freezer to -2 for a full 24 hrs. I placed 2 in my coller with 10lbs of ice and the 3rd one I placed in my backpack cooler with the beer. By the time we headed home on the 3rd day my cooler still had large pieces of ice! Everything kept great! I'm looking forward to using it more for future camping trips
customer_reviews.author: MimiSL

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: Came with very clear instructions and even a handy silicone funnell that made filling easy. On the other hand for the amount of space they take up in the cooler they take up they don't stay cold that long. In a 5 day cooler, my packs were half melted on day 1 and fully melted on day 2. My frozen water bottles were still more than half frozen on day 3 when I got home.
customer_reviews.author: Sara S.

customer_reviews.title: 3 years of use - still works
customer_reviews.text: Acquired these packs 3 years ago and they work great - just bought the mid size for my smaller coolers. Overall the low maintenance is what brought me back. No dealing with ice and water. I have the old version and last year I had to start duct taping the corners as they were coming apart, but it’s merely esthetics at this point. Still stays cold.
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: Cold Beer
customer_reviews.text: See below for update. I love these Cooler Shock ice eliminator packs. Easy to follow instructions to add water and seal shut. I no longer will have to ice down my cooler for my off-roading trips. These things keep my beverages COLD! Update 05/05/17, I'm not so jazzed about these any longer. I purchase these in July 2016, two of them are oozing gel each time I use them when they thaw out. I purchased the heat to seal items. Don't make the same mistake I made, buy the ones that have the stopper and thread on cap. Changed my rating from 5 to three stars. If they didn't ooz gel they would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Can I give them 10 stars?
customer_reviews.text: Wow... these ice packs are wonderful! they stay solid much much longer than anything else I have used. Bought them to keep food cold when taking to picnics. I chose this style as opposed to the solid covered ones because these ones are not as heavy. I use them to place the serving dish on top to help ensure food stays cool and safe to eat. Worked extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Fredsmom

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup. I really like that they lay flat and unobtrusive in the freezer and cooler. I purchased these for my 70 qt. Pelican cooler. We use them to keep our supplies cold while sitting in the bed of a pick up truck for a 3 hour drive to/from Michigan. Everything stays cold/dry and the best part is that the ice packs are still frozen so after unpacking, we keep them in the Pelican to keep beer and beverages ice cold throughout the weekend. Best purchase I made - I actually went back to purchase the lunch box size ice for our small soft-side coolers to take on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Tech_Freak

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Freeze
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Freeze. I was skeptical at first about having to mix the product and iron closed. Well I DID IT! No problem. And the seal is serious and has not opened again. The good news is that these pack last me a good full day in the Florida summer heat. I even throw in unchilled water into the cooler and the packs are able to cool and remain cold all day. Don't over do it...if you put in all warm water bottles, it will be too much to bring them to an icy cold glass of water. Experiment yourself for the optimum performance you are demanding.
customer_reviews.author: GeeWiz

customer_reviews.title: Great Packs Work Wonderfully.  Keep Things Cool
customer_reviews.text: We use these packs in conjunction with the zippered mesh packs. These packs keep things real cool and work well. Mesh covers are recommend as it protects the pack and makes it easier to handle. We use one of these in our cheap portable cooler for taking on the boat and it keeps the beverages cooler than using ice. Less mess as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bigzig

customer_reviews.title: The best freezer packs available
customer_reviews.text: Having tried many freezer packs in the past, I like these the best. I mainly use these in Polar Bear coolers (backpack, 12 and 24 can) and my Yeti Roadie. Very easy to make it ready for use. Just make sure all the air is out and a quick 5 seconds with a hot iron. Just run the iron over the ziplock section only. Keep the iron moving, it doesn't take much to seal it. Very happy with these, they are not as thick as the blue bricks and stay frozen for hours. It always helps to put refrigerate anything if possible before you put in in the cooler. They help the longevity of your ice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ski boy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My son had tried these out with great success so we purchased 3 of these for ourselves. WOW couldn't have been more pleased! We go boating and the cooler is sitting in direct sunlight sometimes all day long. With these everything stayed cold all day and actually we noticed that things were still cold the next morning when we reloaded the cooler for that day. We also had some steaks that we had taken with us on a camping trip and they keep these cool for two days until we were ready to cook them. And the best part...no ice cost and no water dripping all over. I'm going to buy some smaller ones for my other cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing beats this as far as I know.
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my work cooler / lunch box. They are very large and one barley fits in the bottom of mine - but that's all I need all day long. I work a lot of 12 hour days and they are still easily cold when I get off work. Just make sure you have a large box to use these in. I used 2 of these for a tennis tournament I was in. I left the cooler in my truck overnight after the first day of the tournament. So they stayed for over 36 hours in the cooler and were still very cold as were my drinks! Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: RoodyPoo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for road trips/camping
customer_reviews.text: These are great ice packs! Have used these for multi-day car trips and camping trips and they do a great job keeping things cold. I was skeptical when I first bought them but I think they are definitely worth the hype. In one of our trips it kept our food cold for pretty much three full days of sitting out in the sun in 90+ degree weather outside (so even hotter in the car). Of course by the end things weren't super ice cold, but I was really impressed that it could still keep things cool.
customer_reviews.author: aes

product_meta.title: Cooler Shock 3X Lg. Zero°F Cooler Freeze Packs 10x14 inch - No More Ice Replaces Ice and is Reusable - Easy Fill - Add Water and Save! - 12lbs Total - Made in The USA
feature_bullets: 3 PACK large size Screw cap fill and seal – Colder than ice at 18 ℉ (- 8 ℃) Extra-large gel pack makes item slushy cold. Coldest and longest lasting – Several types and sizes available. Click the blue "CoolerShock" at top of page to see all models - USA made, USA support
3 REUSABLE COOLER ICE PACKS REPLACE 18 POUNDS OF ICE, no dirty water in your cooler! Non-hazardous, child safe. Lasts up to 48 hours - Voted #1 in 2017 & 2018 Wiki EzVid Ice Pack competition!

NEW IMPROVED – Nylon reinforced packs now 50% stronger and more durable, capable of 100’s of freeze – thaw cycles. Shipped with Cooler Shock dry Formula - you add water (once) and save money. Simply add water and screw lock cap on.
The key to COOLER SHOCK is burst cooling. Cooler Shock cooler ice packs actually accelerates cooling – 8 mil thick flexible 3 layer foil & nylon pack – Detailed Cooler use guide right on back of pack

1,000,000 + SOLD ON AMAZON - 1 year 100% money back guarantee and fast service. Any issues, simply contact our service team and we will send you new packs. We are easy to reach by phone, email or chat. We stand behind our product. Details on our website at CoolerShock.com NOTE:Our latest screw cap does not have a bottom rim, it has ridges. The cork is the primary seal

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
